alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 8:14PM EDT until July 05 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson, Forsyth and Guilford. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain due to thunderstorms has moved out of the advisory area, while light to moderate rainfall continues. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Kernersville, Clemmons, McLeansville, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Stokesdale, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Colfax, Lake Brandt, Climax, Forest Oaks, Belews Creek and Belews Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
